title: Love in a Cold Climate
author: Nancy Mitford

title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time
author: Mark Haddon

quote_last: , when Catherine’s anxious attention to the weather was over and she could no longer claim any merit from its amendment, the sky began voluntarily to clear. A gleam of sunshine took her quite by surprise; she looked round; the clouds were parting, and she instantly returned to the window to watch over and encourage the happy appearance. Ten minutes more made it certain that a bright afternoon would succeed, and justified the opinion of Mrs. Allen, who had “always thought it would clear up.”
title: Northanger Abbey
author: Jane Austen

quote_last: … Baker, California… Into the Ballantine Ale now, zombie drunk and nervous. I recognize this feeling: three or four days of booze, drugs, sun, no sleep and burned out adrenalin reserves – a giddy, quavering sort of high that means the crash is coming. But when? How much longer?
title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
author: Hunter S. Thompson
